informal_statement: Simplify $(a-1)(a+1)(a+2) - (a-2)(a+1).$ Show that it is a^3 + a^2.
informal_proof:
We successively expand by multiplying binomials: \begin{align*}
(a&-1)(a+1)(a+2) - (a-2)(a+1)\\
&= (a^2-1)(a+2)-(a-2)(a+1)\\
&= (a^3 + 2a^2 - a - 2) - (a^2 -a -2)\\
&= a^3 + a^2.
\end{align*}So our answer is just $a^3 + a^2$.
formal_statement:
theorem mathd_algebra_568:
  fixes a :: real
  shows "(a-1) * (a+1) * (a+2) - (a-2) * (a+1) = a^3 + a^2"
formal_code:
(*
  Authors: Albert Qiaochu Jiang
*)

theory mathd_algebra_568 imports
  Complex_Main
begin

theorem mathd_algebra_568:
  fixes a :: real
  shows "(a-1) * (a+1) * (a+2) - (a-2) * (a+1) = a^3 + a^2"
  sorry

end
